meanings.definition: A system or planned way of doing things, especially one imposed from above.
meanings.sent1: The school had strict regimes for study and playtime.
meanings.sent2: The company implemented new regimes to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The cat had its own feeding regime, demanding meals at precise times.
meanings.sent4: The daily exercise regime was like a well-oiled machine, keeping everyone on track.
meanings.sent5: Following the strict diet regime felt like a never-ending challenge.

meanings.definition: A government, especially an authoritarian one.
meanings.sent1: The oppressive regimes in some countries restrict freedom of speech.
meanings.sent2: The regime in power cracked down on dissenting voices.
meanings.sent3: The strict regime of the king made the citizens fear his rule.
meanings.sent4: Under the iron-fisted regime, citizens lived in constant fear.
meanings.sent5: The authoritarian regime controlled every aspect of people's lives.

meanings.definition: A period during which a particular administration or system is in power.
meanings.sent1: During the regime of the previous president, many changes were made.
meanings.sent2: The regime of the new CEO brought about positive transformations.
meanings.sent3: The regime of the principal was known for its strict discipline.
meanings.sent4: The regime of the coach led to significant improvements in the team's performance.
meanings.sent5: The regime of the mayor was marked by economic growth and development.
